xs:annotation.xs:documentation: An optional public directory for forests.
The scheduled backups for this forest.
The policy to use for assignment and rebalancing.
Larger numbers mean work harder at rebalancing.
The type for the boundaries used by the range assignment policy
An integer internet port number, min 1, max 65534.
A description for this host mode
What policy to use for assignment and rebalancing.
The partition key of the range assignment policy.
If a document does not match any queries in all the partitions, it will be inserted into the default-partition.
It can be absolute or relative.
A day that this backup occurs.
The days that this backup happens.
The day of the month that this backup happens.
What type of backup is this.
How often this backup should run (every n months, weeks, days, hours or minutes).
The starting date (in MM/DD/YYYY notation) for a one-time backup
The date and time this backup was created.
Whether or not a backup is enabled
What policy to use for assignment and rebalancing.
The partition key of the range assignment policy.

If this is true, ranges on all forests in this database include the lower bound but not the upper bound (i.e., [lower-bound, upper-bound)); if this is false, ranges on all forests include the upper bound but not the lower bound (i.e., (lower-bound, upper-bound]).
If a document does not match any queries in all the partitions, it will be inserted into the default-partition.
The optional public directory for forests.
The optional directory for large objects in a forest.
The optional smaller but faster directory for forests.
The unique key of a forest.
Enable assignment to a failover host if the primary host is down.
The kinds of updates that should be allowed for this forest.
Enable automatic rebalancing after configuration changes.
The lower bound of the range on the forest.
The upper bound of the range on the forest.
Range configuration for the range assignment policy.
The license key for this host.
The maximum number of tasks allowed.
The distributed protocol server socket bind internet port number.
The distributed protocol foreign server socket bind internet port number.
The unique ID of the database.
The description for this host mode
The policy to use for assignment and rebalancing.
Larger numbers mean work harder at rebalancing.
Automatically connect local forests with foreign forests of the same name.
The maximum transaction journal lag to the foreign database.
Whether replication is enabled for this replica.
The name of the foreign cluster.
The summary for a list of database partitions.
A brief summary of the partition.
An error limiting the data in the view.
Properties of the view rather than the resource.
An item of this resource type.
Tiered storage forest migrate operation description.
Tiered storage forest combine operation description.
The summary for a list of super-databases.
Another resource that qualifies the resource.
A list of associated resources that distinguish the resource.
Related resources with the same type.
The summary for a list of sub-databases.
A list of hosts for shared disk failover.
A broader or narrower view on the resource or resource type.
A list of broader or narrower views on the resource or resource type.
List of failover forests on this host, which must be moved before the host can be dropped.
List of forests on this host, which must be moved before the host can be dropped.
Detailed output describing failed prerequisites for removing a host from the cluster.
Security database upgrade local cluster operation.
Number of forests to distribute per host.
Number of forests to allocate to each host for partition creation.
Database (name or id) to transfer the partition to.
Boolean indicating that the host is configured as a bootstrap host for cluster coupling. Bootstrap hosts cannot be dropped from the cluster.
Count of scheduled tasks running on this host, which must be removed before the host can be dropped.
A host name or id for shared disk failover.
The path for a resource or list of resources.
The type of a resource or list of resources.
A role that distinguishes the resource.
The numeric identifier for the resource.
The number of items of this resource type.
The timestamp for when the view was generated.
The time required to construct the view. The elapsed time indicates the relative cost of generating the view. Consider the cost when determining how frequently to request a view.
The timestamp for filtering out more recent requests or transactions.
